references.reason: This paper is a technical report on GPT-4, a large language model used in SEAGULL for visual understanding and quality assessment.
This paper introduces the Segment Anything Model (SAM), which is crucial for SEAGULL in accurately extracting mask-based ROIs for image quality assessment.

references.paper_title: Topiq: A top-down approach from semantics to distortions for image quality assessment
references.reason: This paper presents TOPIQ, a full-reference image quality assessment model used in SEAGULL for evaluating the quality of synthetic distortion images.

references.paper_title: Promptiqa: Boosting the performance and generalization for no-reference image quality assessment via prompts
references.reason: This paper proposes PromptIQA, a vision-language model-based IQA method, and provides a basis for SEAGULL's design of instruction-response.
This paper introduces ConvNeXt, a CNN-based model used in SEAGULL as the image encoder to extract robust image tokens for fine-grained ROI quality assessment.
